reasoning_log.comment: The agent cannot move north due to a wall. The goal is detected bearing NE with far strength, so moving east is a reasonable step toward that direction. Moving east is also safe as the adjacent cell is free, avoiding backtracking or collisions.

The agent is facing a wall to the North but has free cells to the East, South, and West. The goal sensor shows the goal bearing towards the East with a FAR strength indication. Moving East aligns with the goal direction and is a safe, unblocked option this turn.
The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the East and at a far distance. The East cell is free, so moving East is the safest action that also progresses toward the goal.

The agent is facing walls to the north and east, and out of bounds to the west, so moving south is the only free and safe option. This avoids immediate backtracking and makes progress away from boundaries.

The agent is blocked to the North and South, with free cells to the East and West. The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the East, albeit far away, so moving East progresses towards the goal safely without backtracking.

Moving north is safe as the adjacent cell to the north is free, and this action aligns better with the goal bearing NE compared to moving west or south. Avoiding backtracking to position (14, 8) also helps progress forward.

The agent is facing a wall to the East but has free cells to the North, South, and West. The goal sensor indicates the goal is towards the East, but East is blocked by a wall. Moving North avoids immediate backtracking to the West (last position) and keeps progress steady without collisions.

The last move was East and is still a free cell. This move avoids immediate backtracking and follows the previous direction of progress. No obstacles or agents are adjacent, so moving East is the safest action to advance toward the goal.

The agent's goal sensor indicates the goal is to the East with far strength, and East is a free cell. The agent avoids backtracking North (last position) and Out of Bounds West, so moving East maximizes progress toward the goal safely.

The agent is blocked to the North and South by walls, with free cells to the East and West. The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the East, albeit far away, so moving East maximizes progress toward the goal without backtracking to the West, which was the previous position.

Moving south is the best option because north and west are blocked by walls, and the east cell is free but moving south aligns better with avoiding immediate backtracking and is a safe move. The recent positions indicate that moving south is not reversing the direction just taken.

The goal sensor indicates the goal is to the East with far strength, and the cell to the East is free. Moving East is the best progression toward the goal while avoiding immediate backtracking and collisions.

Moving west is a safe option as the west cell is free and avoids backtracking to the immediate previous position (which was north). Moving east is blocked by a wall, so moving west advances the agent safely and continues exploration.

Continuing to move East follows the last three moves and advances toward the goal as the East cell is free. This avoids backtracking and respects agent and wall constraints.
